intro: Wettinia verruculosa, commonly known as the woolly wettinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the humid forests of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on its stems and leaves, which gives it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Wettinia verruculosa is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and is valued for its ornamental appearance.
